definitions.definition: to take something quickly and keep or hold it:
examples: I seized his arm and made him turn to look at me.
The rebels have seized ten soldiers to use as hostages.

definitions.definition: If the police or other officials seize something, they take possession of it with legal authority:
examples: Customs officers at Heathrow have seized 60 kilos of heroin.

definitions.definition: If a strong emotion or pain seizes you, you feel it suddenly:
examples: I was suddenly seized by/with a feeling of great insecurity and loneliness.
